Sentencas: Thin films of yttria-stabilized zirconia (YSZ) nanoparticles were prepared using a low-temperature deposition and crystallization process involving successive ionic layer adsorption and reaction (SILAR) or SILAR-Air spray Plus (SILAR-A+) methods, coupled with hydrothermal (175 degrees C) and furnace (500 degrees C) post-annealing.
Titulo: Crack-Free Fabrications of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia Films Using Successive-Ionic-Layer-Adsorption-and-Reaction and Air-Spray Plus Method

Sentencas: The annealed YSZ films resulted in crystalline products, and their phases of monoclinic, tetragonal, and cubic were categorized through X-ray diffraction analysis.
Titulo: Crack-Free Fabrications of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia Films Using Successive-Ionic-Layer-Adsorption-and-Reaction and Air-Spray Plus Method

Sentencas: The morphologies of the as-prepared films, fabricated by SILAR and SILAR-A+ processes, including hydrothermal dehydration and annealing, were characterized by the degree of surface cracking using scanning electron microscopy images.
Titulo: Crack-Free Fabrications of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia Films Using Successive-Ionic-Layer-Adsorption-and-Reaction and Air-Spray Plus Method

Sentencas: Additionally, the thicknesses of the YSZ thin films were compared by removing diffusion layers such as spectator anions and water accumulated during the air spray plus process.
Titulo: Crack-Free Fabrications of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia Films Using Successive-Ionic-Layer-Adsorption-and-Reaction and Air-Spray Plus Method

Sentencas: Crack-free YSZ thin films were successfully fabricated on glass substrates using the SILAR-A+ method, followed by hydrothermal and furnace annealing, making them suitable for application in solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Crack-Free Fabrications of Yttria-Stabilized Zirconia Films Using Successive-Ionic-Layer-Adsorption-and-Reaction and Air-Spray Plus Method
